member.summary: Read the data from a message from the given stream into the given buffer. May reallocate the buffer if it is too small to receive the message. Returns the lenght of the message in bytes. If a stopEvent is specified, this method will return 0 if the event is triggered.

member.summary: Returns true if regular "on-rails" time warp can be used, at the specified warp . The maximum time warp rate is limited by various things, including how close the active vessel is to a planet. See the KSP wiki for details.

member.summary: Launch a vessel.
member.param: Name of the directory in the current saves "Ships" directory, that contains the craft file. For example "VAB" or "SPH".
Name of the vessel to launch. This is the name of the ".craft" file in the save directory, without the ".craft" file extension.
Name of the launch site. For example "LaunchPad" or "Runway".

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.LaunchVesselFromSPH(System.String)
member.summary: Launch a new vessel from the SPH onto the runway.
member.param: Name of the vessel to launch.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to calling with the craft directory set to "SPH" and the launch site set to "Runway".

member.summary: Launch a new vessel from the VAB onto the launchpad.

member.remarks: This is equivalent to calling with the craft directory set to "VAB" and the launch site set to "LaunchPad".

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.WarpTo(System.Double,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Uses time acceleration to warp forward to a time in the future, specified by universal time . This call blocks until the desired time is reached. Uses regular "on-rails" or physical time warp as appropriate. For example, physical time warp is used when the active vessel is traveling through an atmosphere. When using regular "on-rails" time warp, the warp rate is limited by , and when using physical time warp, the warp rate is limited by .
member.param: The universal time to warp to, in seconds.
The maximum warp rate in regular "on-rails" time warp.
The maximum warp rate in physical time warp.
member.returns: When the time warp is complete.

member.summary: Whether the navball is visible.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.PhysicsWarpFactor
member.summary: The physical time warp rate. A value between 0 and 3 inclusive. 0 means no time warp. Returns 0 if regular "on-rails" time warp is active.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.RailsWarpFactor
member.summary:
The time warp rate, using regular "on-rails" time warp. A value between 0 and 7 inclusive. 0 means no time warp. Returns 0 if physical time warp is active.
If requested time warp factor cannot be set, it will be set to the next lowest possible value. For example, if the vessel is too close to a planet. See the KSP wiki for details.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.WarpFactor
member.summary: The current warp factor. This is the index of the rate at which time is passing for either regular "on-rails" or physical time warp. Returns 0 if time warp is not active. When in on-rails time warp, this is equal to , and in physics time warp, this is equal to .

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.WarpMode
member.summary: The current time warp mode. Returns if time warp is not active, if regular "on-rails" time warp is active, or if physical time warp is active.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Service.WarpRate
member.summary: The current warp rate. This is the rate at which time is passing for either on-rails or physical time warp. For example, a value of 10 means time is passing 10x faster than normal. Returns 1 if time warp is not active.

member.name: T:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot
member.summary: Provides basic auto-piloting utilities for a vessel. Created by calling .
member.remarks: If a client engages the auto-pilot and then closes its connection to the server, the auto-pilot will be disengaged and its target reference frame, direction and roll reset to default.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.#ctor(KRPC.Client.IConnection,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Construct an instance of this remote object. Should not be called directly. This interface is intended for internal decoding.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.Disengage
member.summary: Disengage the auto-pilot.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.Engage
member.summary: Engage the auto-pilot.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.TargetPitchAndHeading(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set target pitch and heading angles.
member.param: Target pitch angle, in degrees between -90 and +90.
Target heading angle, in degrees between 0 and 360.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.Wait
member.summary: Blocks until the vessel is pointing in the target direction and has the target roll (if set).

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.AttenuationAngle
member.summary: The angle at which the autopilot considers the vessel to be pointing close to the target. This determines the midpoint of the target velocity attenuation function. A vector of three angles, in degrees, one for each of the pitch, roll and yaw axes. Defaults to 1 for each axis.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.AutoTune
member.summary: Whether the rotation rate controllers PID parameters should be automatically tuned using the vessels moment of inertia and available torque. Defaults to true. See and .

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.DecelerationTime
member.summary: The time the vessel should take to come to a stop pointing in the target direction. This determines the angular acceleration used to decelerate the vessel. A vector of three times, in seconds, one for each of the pitch, roll and yaw axes. Defaults to 5 seconds for each axis.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.Error
member.summary: The error, in degrees, between the direction the ship has been asked to point in and the direction it is pointing in. Returns zero if the auto-pilot has not been engaged and SAS is not enabled or is in stability assist mode.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.HeadingError
member.summary: The error, in degrees, between the vessels current and target heading. Returns zero if the auto-pilot has not been engaged.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.Overshoot
member.summary: The target overshoot percentage used to autotune the PID controllers. A vector of three values, between 0 and 1, for each of the pitch, roll and yaw axes. Defaults to 0.01 for each axis.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.PitchError
member.summary: The error, in degrees, between the vessels current and target pitch. Returns zero if the auto-pilot has not been engaged.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.PitchPIDGains
member.summary: Gains for the pitch PID controller.
member.remarks: When is true, these values are updated automatically, which will overwrite any manual changes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.ReferenceFrame
member.summary: The reference frame for the target direction ().
member.remarks: An error will be thrown if this property is set to a reference frame that rotates with the vessel being controlled, as it is impossible to rotate the vessel in such a reference frame.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.RollError
member.summary: The error, in degrees, between the vessels current and target roll. Returns zero if the auto-pilot has not been engaged or no target roll is set.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.RollPIDGains
member.summary: Gains for the roll PID controller.
member.remarks: When is true, these values are updated automatically, which will overwrite any manual changes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.RollThreshold
member.summary: The threshold at which the autopilot will try to match the target roll angle, if any. Defaults to 5 degrees.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.SAS
member.summary: The state of SAS.
member.remarks: Equivalent to

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.SASMode
member.summary: The current . These modes are equivalent to the mode buttons to the left of the navball that appear when SAS is enabled.
member.remarks: Equivalent to

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.StoppingTime
member.summary: The maximum amount of time that the vessel should need to come to a complete stop. This determines the maximum angular velocity of the vessel. A vector of three stopping times, in seconds, one for each of the pitch, roll and yaw axes. Defaults to 0.5 seconds for each axis.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.TargetDirection
member.summary: Direction vector corresponding to the target pitch and heading.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.TargetHeading
member.summary: The target heading, in degrees, between 0 and 360.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.TargetPitch
member.summary: The target pitch, in degrees, between -90 and +90.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.TargetRoll
member.summary: The target roll, in degrees. NaN if no target roll is set.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.TimeToPeak
member.summary: The target time to peak used to autotune the PID controllers. A vector of three times, in seconds, for each of the pitch, roll and yaw axes. Defaults to 3 seconds for each axis.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.AutoPilot.YawPIDGains
member.summary: Gains for the yaw PID controller.
member.remarks: When is true, these values are updated automatically, which will overwrite any manual changes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.CelestialBody.NonRotatingReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to this celestial body, and orientated in a fixed direction (it does not rotate with the body).
The origin is at the center of the body.
The axes do not rotate.
The x-axis points in an arbitrary direction through the equator.
The y-axis points from the center of the body towards the north pole.
The z-axis points in an arbitrary direction through the equator.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.CelestialBody.Orbit
member.summary: The orbit of the body.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.CelestialBody.OrbitalReferenceFrame
member.summary:
Gets the reference frame that is fixed relative to this celestial body, but orientated with the body's orbital prograde/normal/radial directions.
The origin is at the center of the body.
The axes rotate with the orbital prograde/normal/radial directions.
The x-axis points in the orbital anti-radial direction.
The y-axis points in the orbital prograde direction.
The z-axis points in the orbital normal direction.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.CelestialBody.ReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to the celestial body.
The origin is at the center of the body.
The axes rotate with the body.
The x-axis points from the center of the body towards the intersection of the prime meridian and equator (the position at 0 longitude, 0 latitude).
The y-axis points from the center of the body towards the north pole.
The z-axis points from the center of the body towards the equator at 90E longitude.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.CelestialBody.RotationAngle
member.summary: The current rotation angle of the body, in radians.

member.summary: The sidereal rotational period of the body, in seconds.

member.summary: Undocks the docking port and returns the new that is created. This method can be called for either docking port in a docked pair. Throws an exception if the docking port is not docked to anything.
member.remarks: When called, the active vessel may change. It is therefore possible that, after calling this function, the object(s) returned by previous call(s) to no longer refer to the active vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.DockedPart
member.summary: The part that this docking port is docked to. Returns null if this docking port is not docked to anything.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.HasShield
member.summary: Whether the docking port has a shield.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.Part
member.summary: The part object for this docking port.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.ReengageDistance
member.summary: The distance a docking port must move away when it undocks before it becomes ready to dock with another port, in meters.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.ReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to this docking port, and oriented with the port.
The origin is at the position of the docking port.
The axes rotate with the docking port.
The x-axis points out to the right side of the docking port.
The y-axis points in the direction the docking port is facing.
The z-axis points out of the bottom off the docking port.
member.remarks: This reference frame is not necessarily equivalent to the reference frame for the part, returned by .

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.Shielded
member.summary:
The state of the docking ports shield, if it has one.
Returns true if the docking port has a shield, and the shield is closed. Otherwise returns false. When set to true, the shield is closed, and when set to false the shield is opened. If the docking port does not have a shield, setting this attribute has no effect.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.DockingPort.State
member.summary: The current state of the docking port.

member.name: T:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine
member.summary: An engine, including ones of various types. For example liquid fuelled gimballed engines, solid rocket boosters and jet engines. Obtained by calling .
member.remarks: For RCS thrusters .

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.#ctor(KRPC.Client.IConnection,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Construct an instance of this remote object. Should not be called directly. This interface is intended for internal decoding.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.ToggleMode
member.summary: Toggle the current engine mode.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Active
member.summary: Whether the engine is active. Setting this attribute may have no effect, depending on and .

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.AutoModeSwitch
member.summary: Whether the engine will automatically switch modes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.AvailableThrust
member.summary: The amount of thrust, in Newtons, that would be produced by the engine when activated and with its throttle set to 100%. Returns zero if the engine does not have any fuel. Takes the engine's current and atmospheric conditions into account.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.AvailableTorque
member.summary: The available torque in the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel, in Newton meters. These axes correspond to the coordinate axes of the . Returns zero if the engine is inactive, or not gimballed.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.CanRestart
member.summary: Whether the engine can be restarted once shutdown. If the engine cannot be shutdown, returns false. For example, this is true for liquid fueled rockets and false for solid rocket boosters.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.CanShutdown
member.summary: Whether the engine can be shutdown once activated. For example, this is true for liquid fueled rockets and false for solid rocket boosters.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.GimbalLimit
member.summary: The gimbal limiter of the engine. A value between 0 and 1. Returns 0 if the gimbal is locked.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.GimbalLocked
member.summary: Whether the engines gimbal is locked in place. Setting this attribute has no effect if the engine is not gimballed.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.GimbalRange
member.summary: The range over which the gimbal can move, in degrees. Returns 0 if the engine is not gimballed.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Gimballed
member.summary: Whether the engine is gimballed.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.HasFuel
member.summary: Whether the engine has any fuel available.
member.remarks: The engine must be activated for this property to update correctly.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.HasModes
member.summary: Whether the engine has multiple modes of operation.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.KerbinSeaLevelSpecificImpulse
member.summary: The specific impulse of the engine at sea level on Kerbin, in seconds.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.MaxThrust
member.summary: The amount of thrust, in Newtons, that would be produced by the engine when activated and fueled, with its throttle and throttle limiter set to 100%.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.MaxVacuumThrust
member.summary: The maximum amount of thrust that can be produced by the engine in a vacuum, in Newtons. This is the amount of thrust produced by the engine when activated, is set to 100%, the main vessel's throttle is set to 100% and the engine is in a vacuum.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Mode
member.summary: The name of the current engine mode.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Modes
member.summary: The available modes for the engine. A dictionary mapping mode names to objects.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Part
member.summary: The part object for this engine.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.PropellantNames
member.summary: The names of the propellants that the engine consumes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.PropellantRatios
member.summary: The ratio of resources that the engine consumes. A dictionary mapping resource names to the ratio at which they are consumed by the engine.
member.remarks: For example, if the ratios are 0.6 for LiquidFuel and 0.4 for Oxidizer, then for every 0.6 units of LiquidFuel that the engine burns, it will burn 0.4 units of Oxidizer.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Propellants
member.summary: The propellants that the engine consumes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.SpecificImpulse
member.summary: The current specific impulse of the engine, in seconds. Returns zero if the engine is not active.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Throttle
member.summary: The current throttle setting for the engine. A value between 0 and 1. This is not necessarily the same as the vessel's main throttle setting, as some engines take time to adjust their throttle (such as jet engines).

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.ThrottleLocked
member.summary: Whether the affects the engine. For example, this is true for liquid fueled rockets, and false for solid rocket boosters.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Thrust
member.summary: The current amount of thrust being produced by the engine, in Newtons.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.ThrustLimit
member.summary: The thrust limiter of the engine. A value between 0 and 1. Setting this attribute may have no effect, for example the thrust limit for a solid rocket booster cannot be changed in flight.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.Thrusters
member.summary: The components of the engine that generate thrust.
member.remarks: For example, this corresponds to the rocket nozzel on a solid rocket booster, or the individual nozzels on a RAPIER engine. The overall thrust produced by the engine, as reported by , and others, is the sum of the thrust generated by each thruster.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Engine.VacuumSpecificImpulse
member.summary: The vacuum specific impulse of the engine, in seconds.

member.summary: The altitude above the surface of the body, in meters. When over water, this is the altitude above the sea floor. Measured from the center of mass of the vessel.

member.summary: The position of the center of mass of the vessel.

member.summary: The direction vector that the vessel is pointing in.

member.summary: Gets the coefficient of drag. This is the amount of drag produced by the vessel. It depends on air speed, air density and wing area.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.DynamicPressure
member.summary: The dynamic pressure acting on the vessel, in Pascals. This is a measure of the strength of the aerodynamic forces. It is equal to \frac{1}{2} . \mbox{air density} . \mbox{velocity}^2. It is commonly denoted Q.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.Elevation
member.summary: The elevation of the terrain under the vessel, in meters. This is the height of the terrain above sea level, and is negative when the vessel is over the sea.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.EquivalentAirSpeed
member.summary: The equivalent air speed of the vessel, in m/s.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.GForce
member.summary: The current G force acting on the vessel in m/s^2.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.Heading
member.summary: The heading angle of the vessel relative to north, in degrees. A value between 0 and 360.

member.summary: The horizontal speed of the vessel in meters per second.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.Lift

member.summary: Gets the coefficient of lift. This is the amount of lift produced by the vessel, and depends on air speed, air density and wing area.

member.summary: The longitude of the vessel for the body being orbited, in degrees.

member.summary: The speed of the vessel, in multiples of the speed of sound.

member.summary: The altitude above sea level, in meters. Measured from the center of mass of the vessel.

member.summary: The speed of the vessel in meters per second.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.SpeedOfSound
member.summary: The speed of sound, in the atmosphere around the vessel, in m/s.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.StallFraction
member.summary: Gets the current amount of stall, between 0 and 1. A value greater than 0.005 indicates a minor stall and a value greater than 0.5 indicates a large-scale stall.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.StaticAirTemperature
member.summary: The static (ambient) temperature of the atmosphere around the vessel, in Kelvin.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.StaticPressure
member.summary: The static atmospheric pressure acting on the vessel, in Pascals.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.StaticPressureAtMSL
member.summary: The static atmospheric pressure at mean sea level, in Pascals.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.SurfaceAltitude
member.summary: The altitude above the surface of the body or sea level, whichever is closer, in meters. Measured from the center of mass of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.TerminalVelocity
member.summary: An estimate of the current terminal velocity of the vessel, in m/s. This is the speed at which the drag forces cancel out the force of gravity.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.ThrustSpecificFuelConsumption
member.summary: Gets the thrust specific fuel consumption for the jet engines on the vessel. This is a measure of the efficiency of the engines, with a lower value indicating a more efficient vessel. This value is the number of Newtons of fuel that are burned, per hour, to produce one newton of thrust.
member.remarks: Requires Ferram Aerospace Research.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Flight.TotalAirTemperature
member.summary: The total air temperature of the atmosphere around the vessel, in Kelvin. This temperature includes the and the vessel's kinetic energy.

member.summary: The true air speed of the vessel, in m/s.

member.summary: The velocity vector of the vessel. The magnitude of the vector is the speed of the vessel in meters per second. The direction of the vector is the direction of the vessels motion.

member.name: T:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Module
member.summary:
This can be used to interact with a specific part module. This includes part modules in stock KSP, and those added by mods.
In KSP, each part has zero or more PartModules associated with it. Each one contains some of the functionality of the part. For example, an engine has a "ModuleEngines" part module that contains all the functionality of an engine.

member.summary: Removes the maneuver node.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.DeltaV
member.summary: The delta-v of the maneuver node, in meters per second.
member.remarks: Does not change when executing the maneuver node. See .

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.Normal
member.summary: The magnitude of the maneuver nodes delta-v in the normal direction, in meters per second.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.Orbit
member.summary: The orbit that results from executing the maneuver node.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.OrbitalReferenceFrame
member.summary:
Gets the reference frame that is fixed relative to the maneuver node, and orientated with the orbital prograde/normal/radial directions of the original orbit at the maneuver node's position.
The origin is at the position of the maneuver node.
The x-axis points in the orbital anti-radial direction of the original orbit, at the position of the maneuver node.
The y-axis points in the orbital prograde direction of the original orbit, at the position of the maneuver node.
The z-axis points in the orbital normal direction of the original orbit, at the position of the maneuver node.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.Prograde
member.summary: The magnitude of the maneuver nodes delta-v in the prograde direction, in meters per second.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.Radial
member.summary: The magnitude of the maneuver nodes delta-v in the radial direction, in meters per second.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.ReferenceFrame
member.summary:
Gets the reference frame that is fixed relative to the maneuver node's burn.
The origin is at the position of the maneuver node.
The y-axis points in the direction of the burn.
The x-axis and z-axis point in arbitrary but fixed directions.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.RemainingDeltaV
member.summary: Gets the remaining delta-v of the maneuver node, in meters per second. Changes as the node is executed. This is equivalent to the delta-v reported in-game.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.TimeTo
member.summary: The time until the maneuver node will be encountered, in seconds.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Node.UT
member.summary: The universal time at which the maneuver will occur, in seconds.

member.summary: The axis-aligned bounding box of the vessel in the given reference frame. Returns the minimum and maximum vertices of the box.
member.remarks: This is computed from the collision meshes of the part. If the part is not collidable, the box has zero volume and is centered on the of the part.

member.summary: The position of the parts center of mass in the given reference frame. If the part is physicsless, this is equivalent to .

member.summary: Exert an instantaneous force on the part, acting at the given position.
member.remarks: The force is applied instantaneously in a single physics update.

member.summary: The position of the part in the given reference frame.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.CenterOfMassReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to this part, and centered on its center of mass.
The origin is at the center of mass of the part, as returned by .
The axes rotate with the part.
The x, y and z axis directions depend on the design of the part.
member.remarks: For docking port parts, this reference frame is not necessarily equivalent to the reference frame for the docking port, returned by .

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature of the part, in Kelvin.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalConductionFlux
member.summary: The rate at which heat energy is conducting into or out of the part via contact with other parts. Measured in energy per unit time, or power, in Watts. A positive value means the part is gaining heat energy, and negative means it is losing heat energy.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalConvectionFlux
member.summary: The rate at which heat energy is convecting into or out of the part from the surrounding atmosphere. Measured in energy per unit time, or power, in Watts. A positive value means the part is gaining heat energy, and negative means it is losing heat energy.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalInternalFlux
member.summary: The rate at which heat energy is begin generated by the part. For example, some engines generate heat by combusting fuel. Measured in energy per unit time, or power, in Watts. A positive value means the part is gaining heat energy, and negative means it is losing heat energy.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalMass
member.summary: A measure of how much energy it takes to increase the internal temperature of the part, in Joules per Kelvin.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalRadiationFlux
member.summary: The rate at which heat energy is radiating into or out of the part from the surrounding environment. Measured in energy per unit time, or power, in Watts. A positive value means the part is gaining heat energy, and negative means it is losing heat energy.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalResourceMass
member.summary: A measure of how much energy it takes to increase the temperature of the resources contained in the part, in Joules per Kelvin.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalSkinMass
member.summary: A measure of how much energy it takes to increase the skin temperature of the part, in Joules per Kelvin.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Part.ThermalSkinToInternalFlux
member.summary: The rate at which heat energy is transferring between the part's skin and its internals. Measured in energy per unit time, or power, in Watts. A positive value means the part's internals are gaining heat energy, and negative means its skin is gaining heat energy.

member.summary: The vessel that contains this part.

member.name: T:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.ReferenceFrame
member.summary:
Represents a reference frame for positions, rotations and velocities. Contains:
The position of the origin.
The directions of the x, y and z axes.
The linear velocity of the frame.
The angular velocity of the frame.
member.remarks: This class does not contain any properties or methods. It is only used as a parameter to other functions.

member.summary: Create a hybrid reference frame, which is a custom reference frame whose components are inherited from other reference frames.
member.param: The reference frame providing the position of the origin.
The reference frame providing the orientation of the frame.
The reference frame providing the linear velocity of the frame.
The reference frame providing the angular velocity of the frame.
member.remarks: The is required but all other reference frames are optional. If omitted, they are set to the reference frame.

member.summary: Create a relative reference frame.
member.param: The offset of the position of the origin.
The rotation to apply to the parent frames rotation, as a quaternion. Defaults to zero.
The linear velocity to offset the parent frame by. Defaults to zero.
The angular velocity to offset the parent frame by. Defaults to zero.

member.summary: The direction of the force generated by the thruster, when the engine is in its initial position (no gimballing), in the given reference frame. This is opposite to the direction in which the thruster expels propellant.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.InitialThrustPosition(KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.ReferenceFrame)
member.summary: The position at which the thruster generates thrust, when the engine is in its initial position (no gimballing), in the given reference frame.
member.remarks: This position can move when the gimbal rotates. This is because the thrust position and gimbal position are not necessarily the same.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.ThrustDirection(KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.ReferenceFrame)
member.summary: The direction of the force generated by the thruster, in the given reference frame. This is opposite to the direction in which the thruster expels propellant. For gimballed engines, this takes into account the current rotation of the gimbal.

member.name: M:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.ThrustPosition(KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.ReferenceFrame)
member.summary: The position at which the thruster generates thrust, in the given reference frame. For gimballed engines, this takes into account the current rotation of the gimbal.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.GimbalAngle
member.summary: The current gimbal angle in the pitch, roll and yaw axes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.Gimballed
member.summary: Whether the thruster is gimballed.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.Part
member.summary: The that contains this thruster.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Thruster.ThrustReferenceFrame
member.summary:
A reference frame that is fixed relative to the thruster and orientated with its thrust direction (). For gimballed engines, this takes into account the current rotation of the gimbal.
The origin is at the position of thrust for this thruster ().
The axes rotate with the thrust direction. This is the direction in which the thruster expels propellant, including any gimballing.
The y-axis points along the thrust direction.
The x-axis and z-axis are perpendicular to the thrust direction.

member.summary: The maximum torque that the aerodynamic control surfaces can generate. Returns the torques in N.m around each of the coordinate axes of the vessels reference frame (). These axes are equivalent to the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.AvailableEngineTorque
member.summary: The maximum torque that the currently active and gimballed engines can generate. Returns the torques in N.m around each of the coordinate axes of the vessels reference frame (). These axes are equivalent to the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.AvailableOtherTorque
member.summary: The maximum torque that parts (excluding reaction wheels, gimballed engines, RCS and control surfaces) can generate. Returns the torques in N.m around each of the coordinate axes of the vessels reference frame (). These axes are equivalent to the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.AvailableRCSTorque
member.summary: The maximum torque that the currently active RCS thrusters can generate. Returns the torques in N.m around each of the coordinate axes of the vessels reference frame (). These axes are equivalent to the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.AvailableReactionWheelTorque
member.summary: The maximum torque that the currently active and powered reaction wheels can generate. Returns the torques in N.m around each of the coordinate axes of the vessels reference frame (). These axes are equivalent to the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.AvailableThrust
member.summary: Gets the total available thrust that can be produced by the vessel's active engines, in Newtons. This is computed by summing for every active engine in the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.AvailableTorque
member.summary: The maximum torque that the vessel generate. Includes contributions from reaction wheels, RCS, gimballed engines and aerodynamic control surfaces. Returns the torques in N.m around each of the coordinate axes of the vessels reference frame (). These axes are equivalent to the pitch, roll and yaw axes of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.DryMass

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.InertiaTensor
member.summary: The inertia tensor of the vessel around its center of mass, in the vessels reference frame (). Returns the 3x3 matrix as a list of elements, in row-major order.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.KerbinSeaLevelSpecificImpulse
member.summary: The combined specific impulse of all active engines at sea level on Kerbin, in seconds. This is computed using the formula described here.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.MET
member.summary: The mission elapsed time in seconds.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Mass
member.summary: The total mass of the vessel, including resources, in kg.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.MaxThrust
member.summary: The total maximum thrust that can be produced by the vessel's active engines, in Newtons. This is computed by summing for every active engine.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.MaxVacuumThrust
member.summary: The total maximum thrust that can be produced by the vessel's active engines when the vessel is in a vacuum, in Newtons. This is computed by summing for every active engine.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.MomentOfInertia
member.summary: The moment of inertia of the vessel around its center of mass in kg.m^2. The inertia values are around the pitch, roll and yaw directions respectively. This corresponds to the vessels reference frame ().

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Name
member.summary: The name of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Orbit
member.summary: The current orbit of the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.OrbitalReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to the vessel, and orientated with the vessels orbital prograde/normal/radial directions.
The origin is at the center of mass of the vessel.
The axes rotate with the orbital prograde/normal/radial directions.
The x-axis points in the orbital anti-radial direction.
The y-axis points in the orbital prograde direction.
The z-axis points in the orbital normal direction.
member.remarks: Be careful not to confuse this with 'orbit' mode on the navball.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Parts
member.summary: A object, that can used to interact with the parts that make up this vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Recoverable
member.summary: Whether the vessel is recoverable.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.ReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to the vessel, and orientated with the vessel.
The origin is at the center of mass of the vessel.
The axes rotate with the vessel.
The x-axis points out to the right of the vessel.
The y-axis points in the forward direction of the vessel.
The z-axis points out of the bottom off the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Resources
member.summary: A object, that can used to get information about resources stored in the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Situation
member.summary: The situation the vessel is in.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.SpecificImpulse
member.summary: The combined specific impulse of all active engines, in seconds. This is computed using the formula described here.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.SurfaceReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to the vessel, and orientated with the surface of the body being orbited.
The origin is at the center of mass of the vessel.
The axes rotate with the north and up directions on the surface of the body.
The x-axis points in the zenith direction (upwards, normal to the body being orbited, from the center of the body towards the center of mass of the vessel).
The y-axis points northwards towards the astronomical horizon (north, and tangential to the surface of the body -- the direction in which a compass would point when on the surface).
The z-axis points eastwards towards the astronomical horizon (east, and tangential to the surface of the body -- east on a compass when on the surface).
member.remarks: Be careful not to confuse this with 'surface' mode on the navball.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.SurfaceVelocityReferenceFrame
member.summary:
The reference frame that is fixed relative to the vessel, and orientated with the velocity vector of the vessel relative to the surface of the body being orbited.
The origin is at the center of mass of the vessel.
The axes rotate with the vessel's velocity vector.
The y-axis points in the direction of the vessel's velocity vector, relative to the surface of the body being orbited.
The z-axis is in the plane of the astronomical horizon.
The x-axis is orthogonal to the other two axes.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.Thrust
member.summary: The total thrust currently being produced by the vessel's engines, in Newtons. This is computed by summing for every engine in the vessel.

member.name: P:KRPC.Client.Services.SpaceCenter.Vessel.VacuumSpecificImpulse
member.summary: The combined vacuum specific impulse of all active engines, in seconds. This is computed using the formula described here.
